title: The benefits to biodiversity of a strong circular economy - European Environment Agency
summary: The circular economy aims to reduce environmental impacts by minimizing the use of materials and energy while reducing waste. Circular economy principles can provide solutions for more sustainable production and consumption patterns, which benefit biodiversity and nature through reduced resource extraction, lower emissions, and less waste. A biodiversity-inclusive circular economy that emphasizes biodiversity-friendly sourcing of materials can help reduce the current alarming trend of biodiversity loss.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes how the circular economy can reduce the impact of our production and consumption systems on biodiversity through three key areas of intersection: reducing primary resource demand, preventing pollution, and promoting biodiversity-friendly supply.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific product or business process that meets the criteria to be a business innovation.

green_process: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific process that meets the criteria to be a green process.

title: A circular economy for critical minerals is fundamental for our future - Deloitte
summary: Critical minerals are key components of modern and low-carbon technologies but their supply is in jeopardy due to complex, volatile and opaque supply chains. The UK government has produced a strategy that includes the need to maximise the use of critical minerals by adopting circular economy principles which is much more than recycling. Implementing a circular approach for critical minerals has opportunities and challenges.

title: WCEF2023 Summary Report - Sitra
summary: The World Circular Economy Forum 2023 gathered speakers and attendees to discuss how circular economy solutions can help nature and the economy. Key themes included the need for collaboration, strengthening finance and policy to support circular businesses, regenerating land, translating global ideas to local solutions, prioritizing human well-being, and rethinking consumption and business practices. Representatives from various sectors shared examples of circular economy innovations, including regenerative agriculture, innovative materials, and waste reduction initiatives.

title: Seizing the Opportunity of E-Waste Recycling | BCG - BCG
summary: The current e-waste recycling system faces challenges, including minimal landfill bans, varied and limited recycling programs, expensive logistics relative to recovered value, sparse or infrequent collection in rural areas, and limited consumer awareness. Exporting, insufficient domestic processing capacity, and commodity price volatility are additional obstacles. Steps to improve the situation include legislation/regulation to mandate recycling and penalize exports, public-private partnerships to facilitate responsible recycling, incentives for collection and recycling, upgrading separation/refining technology, establishing a domestic recycling network, adopting circularity-by-design principles to make products more durable and easier to repair/recycle, and implementing everything-as-a-service business models.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes several green innovations including circularity-by-design principles, digital product passports, improved sorting, and refining technology, advanced mechanical sorting of fine granulates, everything-as-a-service business models, and a domestic recycling network.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article describes several business innovations including improved/new products and processes, the use of incentives, the implementation of take-back programs, continuous consumer education about e-waste, value recovery rebates, long-term contracts, establishment of a national recycling network. circularity-by-design principles, digital product passports, enhanced separation/refining technology, advanced mechanical sorting of fine granulates, everything-as-a-service business models, and a domestic recycling network.
green_product: TRUE. The article describes several green products, including products made from lightweight materials, easily separable monomaterials, and products designed for repairability and longevity.
green_process: TRUE. The article describes several green processes, including responsible e-waste recycling, digital product passports, advanced mechanical sorting of fine granulates, robotic processing, and everything-as-a-service business models

title: Design Shanghai to spotlight brands bridging east and west - Dezeen
summary: Design Shanghai, Asia's largest design event, will return for its 10th anniversary from 8 to 11 June 2023, with a focus on the meeting of eastern and western design philosophies. The trade fair will feature new products from international brands as well as Chinese brands that involve collaborations between Asia and Europe or the US. Installations, exhibitions, a design forum, and networking events will also be part of the event.
green_innovation: TRUE, the design fair focuses on sustainability and green innovations.
business_innovation: TRUE, the design fair will showcase new and innovative products and processes from international and Chinese brands.

title: “Impact First” investment fund 'Transform Health Fund' will help to improve access to healthcare in Africa - Philips
summary: Philips is involved in the Transform Health Fund, which provides access to quality and affordable healthcare. Philips' involvement is inspiring other corporations to invest in the fund, demonstrating that private capital can be a catalyst for health system improvements. Investing in the fund is a way to have a positive impact on a pressing issue.
green_innovation: TRUE. The Transform Health Fund invests in healthcare companies that are improving health systems in low- and middle-income countries with the aim of improving healthcare access for underserved populations.

title: Four Aldi Finds this week including perfect gift ideas for Father’s Day starting at $5... - The US Sun
summary: Aldi is selling a variety of Father's Day-themed products, including a beer candle, BBQ tool set, outdoor fire pit, and fruit smoothie seltzer. These products are all priced under $60 and would make great gifts for dads who enjoy grilling, drinking beer, or spending time outdoors. Aldi also has a variety of other Aldi Finds this week, including home goods, clothing, and grocery items.

title: Day One from 3 Days of Design in Copenhagen - Dezeen
summary: Dezeen's team is reporting live from the 10th edition of 3 Days of Design in Copenhagen, an international design and architecture event showcasing sustainable innovations. The inaugural day featured a comprehensive exhibition by Ukurant, a platform for young designers, which highlighted emerging talent and eco-conscious design practices. Additionally, Nemo Lighting showcased its collection of Le Corbusier and Charlotte Perriand lamps, emphasizing the enduring legacy of modern design and its alignment with contemporary sustainability values.
green_innovation: TRUE. The event showcases sustainable innovations and eco-conscious design practices, promoting environmental sustainability goals.
